newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Enterprise Oil in Bulgaria oil deal.
newsitem.headline: Enterprise Oil in Bulgaria oil deal.

text.p: Britain's Enterprise Oil Plc has signed a contract with Romania's state-run Petrom RA oil company to drill one well, plus one option well, in Block II offshore Bulgaria, a company executive said.
"We plan to start work on the project within a month from now," Nicolae Vidu, business manager of Bucharest-based Enterprise Oil Exploration Ltd, told Reuters.

Vidu said the well in the Black Sea, the Balgarevo East, would be drilled by Petrom's offshore subsidiary Petromar SA with the jack-up rig Atlas, one of seven such rigs Petrom uses for drilling and production purposes in the Black Sea, the Marmara Sea and the Gulf.
"We are talking about a project worth many millions of dollars. At this stage it is difficult for me to give a figure for the total costs, having in mind the options," Vidu said.
Enterprise's partner in Bulgaria is the Bulgarian Committee for Geology and Mineral Resources.
The company has been active in the Black Sea since 1991, when it got licences in blocks XIII and XV offshore Romania as well as in Bulgarian offshore blocks II and VI.
Three wells have been drilled by Enterprise in block XV, one of which tested gas at a rate of 17 million cubic feet a day of dry gas.
Enterprise is the operator with 65 percent interest in a production-sharing agreement on offshore blocks XV and XIII, with Romania's state-owned Rompetrol SA.
Occidental Petroleum Corp has a 30 percent working interest and OGY Petroleums five percent in the project.

In 1991 Romania offered concessions to several Western firms, including Royal Dutch/Shell Group RDA.S, Canadian Occidental Petroleum Ltd, Enterprise and Amoco. -- Adrian Dascalu, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
